title: An Event-based Framework for Characterizing the Evolutionary Behavior of Interaction Graphs

For instance, the modular nature of interaction networks is of particular importance in the case of coexpression networks.
Dense components provide information about useful functional modules, and in the case of social networks, clusters can provide information about Community structure.

A merge event is when a significant portion of two clusters combined to form a new cluster in the next snapshot.
The reverse of this is the split event where a cluster splits up into component clusters.
Form event is when you have a new cluster created by nodes which were not clustered together in the previous snapshot.
